VK8xWt3sTV4nQUnDIDmOgQ.text: A lovely place to eat we had a great meal. Only problem was the service we had to keep asking for drinks and the service charge was a little steep. Would give it another go though

kzu1iSzQySGlD_SnMgx9qQ.text: Must try the lemon merengue cheesecake. Amazing stuff. Everything else was good. Reasonable price

fIydOg7QgSlEVWLBZV0KsQ.text: Excellent breakfast. Flexible menu, no problem substituting scrambled eggs with poached. Nice crispy bacon. Great sourdough bread. High quality tea served in big pot. Great service, very pleasant staff.

zxmc5u9CDVIb3FkWIWb3bA.text: Right inside the High Street Kensington station, Bills is a little gem for casual dining. I only had to wait once, but otherwise, seating is fast. Good, fresh food, with a wide variety. Good service and lively/friendly atmosphere. Good for casual small plates over wine, or full breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

MOxXtTvCz4vqNzrwe0fpHw.text: This was ok but beware, it is NOT Bill's from Australia despite what other reviewer said. The scrambled eggs were very dry. I sent them back and the replacements were soft and creamy. Much better. Raspberry and peach juice was good, coffee was reasonable. The jams were terrific and the service was great

7Cci0QBlaxxeyatjumq9yA.text: My wife and I had breakfast here when visiting London last week. The food was pretty good and the service was solid. It's hard to describe, but it is inside a mall/shopping center area. I recommend the English Breakfast.

j8pTeVdXhW6P6ebNbUaBVQ.text: I am giving four stars in particular for the service.  The staff is so good that it makes the food taste better.  Each and everyone of the staff is trying to please you.  My server read me the wi-fi code because I forgot my eyeglasses and couldn't see it from my table.  Food:  I went for breakfast but because I'm timezone challenged I was an hour late.  I ordered a duck pie....my only regret.  It was ok but I would not order it again.  But why four stars  you ask?  The staff!!! I am not a generous reviewer.  I'm just a poor orderer.  I will definitely go to Bills again and ask the server what I should order.  Conveniently located inside the mall to enter High Street Kensington tube station.

JZg-wP5iVhukVIXh-Xyosg.text: Had breakfast here this morning.  Perfect scrambled eggs, lovely service, reasonable price.  They seem to be doing it right.

SphIIw7bVAS-Yw1kCrf-pw.text: Pancakes were ok, English breakfast wasn't. The fried eggs and bacon came out cold and our party of 5 waited over 40 minutes for our food.

c9euwiiP4Ycjf8HcWSpMZA.text: lovely ambiance:) the Vegetarian breakfast is great! The poach egg is awesome. Good location at High Street Kensington station. They serve breakfast till supper!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. lovely ambiance:)

LlUAuZ8A1W7V-bnejeK6xw.text: I was visiting a friend who was busy one morning so went to Bill's by myself. Really nice service and good food.

0B0KXe_gA-sesIEB2pWcZA.text: The best breakfast of my life! Fiancé and I arrived in london yesterday and saw this little place tucked away in the tube station.  It's charming.  When the food came to the table I was a little apprehensive.  Flavors that I would not have ever thought to put together that harmonized perfectly.  I have the vegetarian breakfast and my fiancé had Bills breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian breakfast
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

YULloMPTv2A6TFzuG-sblA.text: Alright eating experience, but just averageBreakfast came out surprisingly quick, pancakes tasted a bit like playing cardsIs what it is

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast tea came with floaters, think the kettle needs cleaning!

YpuZ3MTXuWK7qITAKDjMug.text: Delicious breakfast! Large portions. Had the "Bill's Breakfast". Great flavors. Asked for a mimosa and they didn't know what it was, but when I told them the ingredients they made me a pretty solid one in a big glass. Great ambiance too-- industrial looking on the inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bills breakfast

63H3rg7vTUpquU1cGB-D8w.text: Just stopped into this one for a drink before ending the evening. The service was pretty slow considering the number of customers, but we eventually got there. Not exactly the best, but decent enough.

pTwt5bA19bFQkPxu3GyEuQ.text: Great decor, fun menu, fair prices.  Painfully slow service.  Horribly dry chicken.  Disappointing at best.

uPaw8GRuNQFEyU4zrRKPag.text: The food wasn't very good, had extremely small portions and it was quite expensive. However, the drinks were tasty... but a bit weak. The service was decent but not exceptional.We had two jars of PIMMs and fruit, fried squid, Lamb kofta plate, and a plate of ribs. Altogether is cost 70 quid. Not worth it. Avoid this tourist trap.

VF9hPuBexqm6CS9yPw6_ng.text: Well located just outside the entrance to High street Kensington tube, I really like this place. It's my first visit, and I've found the staff to be cheerful and friendly, there's a nice atmosphere too without it being too noisy. I ordered the eggs Benedict and a latte. Both of which were textbook. The muffin halves are both sizeable and tasty. There was a good amount of hand carved Han without it being excessive. The eggs were beautifully golden yolked and perfectly poached. The hollandaise was delicious, being light with a nice note of lemon running through it. I can certainly recommend it here and will definitely visit again when I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict

hB02h4PYQyBuUcbwQ17ATA.text: Just an amazing place. The staff are great and the food is delicious. If I could I'd sit here all day. I often take calls for work here which is great as you often have noisy environments when you sit in restaurants and bills is relaxing and cosy. A must try.

n6bQ__tQKxUQrXxnGlQKkQ.text: A friend and myself have a brunch at least once per month and we are always on the lookout for new places to eat. So we decided to give the Bill's chain a try. Eggs Royal was simply to die for, and my friend loved the pancakes with bacon. The staff are super attentive, and even though we were sat upstairs initially on our own, the staff never forgot us. Two cups of coffee, a delicious brunch, and a lot of laughs later, we left feeling on top of the world. We made a reservation, but I think you could still manage to walk in and get a table. It was mothers day the Sunday we went, and there were still a few spare tables dotted around.

LCwe9V6mtsVDpXO0-lhQWA.text: Brunch! I was starting to come to the conclusion that they don't do brunch in London & almost gave up hope of having a bloody mary but then we exited The High St. Kensington Underground. Bill's to the rescue! We stopped, looked at the menu & I began to have hope again. The place was quite charming. The menu has a wide variety of fresh foods. They also have a sweet shop & we got a bunch of them to bring back to The States with us, all of them were very good. I had a spinach, bacon, avocado salad & tortilla chips that came with tzatziki, salsa, & guacamole. My husband had an English breakfast. It was all very good. It was Sunday, about 11:30 a.m. and we were seated right away, it wasn't very crowded. We had fine service. I would defintely go back if in London again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bloody Mary
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Tortilla chips & spinach, avacado, bacon salad
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast

cGIpcACBIwlwdVImtZKQMQ.text: Great burger!dessert was also very nice and refreshing!ordered naked burger and Erin mess!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Chicken skewers were nice too, very tender.
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

mq4qQs3pOn1L_k59LiX8gA.text: We stpooed by for desert quiwt late in the night. The stuff was very kind and served us a delicious lemon cheese cake and a pecan pie with a smily face. Atmosphere was very cosy and guests were decent as well.

r70kWsKFpMidhT4Zq4xrpA.text: Bill' was very good and upbeat. We had the fish pie and the chicken green curry. We were there about 3 pm and had no wait even though it was busy. The menu has more that I'd like to try on our next trip here and the staff are very happy and friendly. They make you feel like you're their best customers even when it's your first time here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Special Chicken Green Curry. Very good, as well.
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill's Fish Pie. Yummy

ngx3cDQcmZamiNdRZLTgQw.text: Bills was a lovely place for breakfast located just on the walk towards the High St. Kensington Station. It's close to shopping and transport and was excellent before visiting Kensington Palace, just a few blocks  away. There is a very sweet and cozy atmosphere to enjoy a meal or to just stop in for a cup of tea. It's in a bustling area with commuters, but it isn't too loud and makes a perfect spot for people watching!  The service was kind and efficient and the meals were well portioned and priced. I ordered the vegetarian breakfast, which included two pieces of toast and two poached eggs. Although the eggs were a little over done, it was a filling meal and quite nice with the hummus and avo offered for the bread. I would definitely recommend this Bills to anyone in the area.

cL5tzEps7NDIaCnPyhM87Q.text: The food was slightly above average and atmosphere was nice, but service left a lot to be desired and is overpriced by a slight but noticeable amount.

eDlzjaP4GjX2D_bywoDBBQ.text: We came at around 10am on June 19.  The waiter did not want to seat us and he said the restaurant was completely booked all day. He was rude and had a prejudice attitude.

EupbW5VxkojoMgckaZkvFA.text: Entering through a shopping centre doesn't really fill you with much hope for ambiance,  but once inside the restaurant has the same homely ambiance of others in the chain. I had the spinach, avocado and bacon salad with a side of sweet potato fries. Salad was tasty, although the avocado and most of the bacon was hiding in the middle so took a bit of mixing to evenly distribute them, but that's only a minor point, it was a good salad.  Sweet potato fries were tasty, but a little on the limp side. Not gastro cuisine, but a good, homely food that was great on a miserable winter's day

dI01Axe1_yEyYijmqXr4og.text: This was good but the meal was lacking a side or something. I should've asked beforehand but I assumed it would be a bit heartier. We both had Eggs Benedict. Their iced tea is sweetened which I can't stand but again, I should've asked. It also tastes like Lipton peach tea (instant) w mint in it. It has that weird aftertaste. The staff were friendly & the place is cute & clean. Additionally, it wasn't super hot inside like we've encountered here (it's fall). Very cozy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

e9pZPPooL3wKaYi2G2sOKA.text: I should know better than eating at a restaurant in the arcade to the tube. Convenience usually offsets quality. They hurried me to a nice table out front. Then a table was seated next to me. After they got water and menus I had to ask if I might expect the same. It almost seemed like they had to think about the request!The sign outside says breakfast-lunch-dinner 24 hours but doesn't mean you can get breakfast 24 hours. Bummer as that's what I was hoping for. They do have a bunch of selections with Halloumi and I love that. Be warned - the Halloumi burger has no burger but was quite good. I'm upping what started as two stars to three. Food was surprisingly better than expected.

RGBNdd4JldcNRyStIksK3g.text: This is inside station building I dropped by at lunch time. I ordered the signature dish, fish pie, this is literally signature, impressive one.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

HoDSDa53VBJEiUhNRFIYmQ.text: We just came for drinks and dessert, the cinnamon donuts with caramel sauce was amazing! Service was good and the espresso martini was great too!

98HJ6B1khXH5eg951oC3ng.text: Bill's was an unexpectedly delicious good time! After walking around Kensington Palace and the Gardens, we stopped by here for dinner. We ordered a couple of cocktails and shared Bill's Sharing Platter, the Sea Bass and Sirloin steak with mushroom sauce. What a satisfying and delicious family style meal we had. We saved room in our bellies of course and got 2 desserts: the Chocolate Dome/Bomb and Sticky Toffee Pudding. Hands down -- the BEST sticky toffee pudding I've ever had. This place is a must try. The ambience was amazing -- lit candles on the tables and quirky furniture. All the staff were also attentive. We have to give a special shout-out to our AWESOME and super friendly server Renata (from Lithuania). Thanks Renata!!! Hope to see you in Canada some time. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. With the ice cream
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Sticky Toffee Pudding (there's real chunks of toffee in there!)
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate Bomb/Dome

0XObeJEjY4I0lhfRQ6wqqg.text: +++- Bill's breakfast is huge and hearty(This is 3 breakfasts poured in one)- I'm from the US, the sausage was different than I'm used to, but pleasant tasting++- Setting is cool- great wifi+- prompt service- Wife enjoyed poached eggs- Tea was tasty-- drinks were a little slow

cT2LU_HcWfjbF8iLvERUJA.text: They have a bottled strawberry lemonade drink that is specific to their restaurant and it is YUMMY!  We bought two big ones to drink this week and I want to go back and get more.   But you also want a review of the restaurant eh?  Well... I loved the atmosphere and the wait staff was kind and good.  The pace here is slower than I'm used to in the US, but I find that is the norm for Europe and am enjoying forcing myself to slow down.  Jack had ribs, which were yummy!  Fall off the bone good.  Mama had a chicken burger she thought was excellent.  I did Steak and Eggs and honestly didn't care for it, but I think it may be more of a culture thing vs. it not being good.  I was expecting a medium well steak - this was well done, but really thin so he probably couldn't avoid it.   The eggs only came fried with the yellow on the top which is not how I like them, but when in England - do it the English way!   Overall I would recommend the restaurant - just stay away from the steak and eggs if you are used to it the US way :)

tzGoDBWgYtPJG1s4AIhbVg.text: My husband and I stopped by Bill's very late at night (~11pm) after we went to the theatre. We didn't realize that they were just getting ready to close until we sat down and we said we would make it quick. They were super friendly and allowed us to stay while they closed up and they didn't rush us at all which was very nice. I ordered a mint tea and it was amazing. My husband ordered a black tea which was also good. Coming to Bill's late at night was a great experience for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Mint tea-delicious!

FJXzwIWiikaFcIC-tW0-Gg.text: ServiceWe were greeted immediately by the host.  The server started out very friendly and enthusiastic but after our orders were taken, he never checked on us.  We flagged another server, a young lady.  She was very cordial and gave us great recommendations.  But for the most part they were friendly.FoodMezze-this the equivalent of a sampler platter in the States.  Calamari, fried tortilla chips (flavorful), crab cakes, chicken on a skewer (has an Indian twist to a bbq flavor).  This was good.  Steak,eggs and chips (Fries)- bland skirt steak, Cooked medium.  Steak had absolutely no flavor but I still cleaned my plate.  The eggs were cooked to perfection, it almost tastes like they were poached.  Americans, you must ask for ketchup.  I asked for ketchup and malt vinegar.Dessert-choco pudding topped with chocolate syrup, caramel, choco and vanilla ice cream.  Very good.  Portion was small for the price.

Pg476YXwmXahjPyLZu2-7w.text: Went for Sunday brunch. Had the Bill's Cream Tea to share which was a pot of tea, two scones, clotted cream and strawberry sponge cake. The tea was good. The scones were OK, not crumbly at all, kind of yeasty. The clotted cream was great. The strawberry along cake it came with was awful. We took one bite and nearly spit it out. Too sweet. Inedible. We had the pancakes and eggs Benedict. Both were so bad we could barely eat them. The pancakes were swimming in a pool of syrup. Why not jus give syrup on the side? The eggs benny had too little hollandaise. Dry, bland, pointless.

MtUZ1Gv12gj3IKn54G0bTA.text: I went to Kensinton High Station to meet up with a friend and after that we were going to look for a breakfast place. We ran into Bill's and had a phenomenal time. Food was delicious - my Eggs Benedict were fantastic and service was great. It was cozy and fun. Great service as well. Loved it.

GbV5n5fAIrWQBckdug2jqw.text: Anytime I go to London I have to stop by this place and have this amazing fish pie, it tastes like home away from home .

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

bS9Qz_5WGkjyWZomimOZZw.text: Always a great meal at Bill's. We were out with 10 other friends...so quite a large group. The High Kensington store seems to be rather new...as there seem to be a lot of contruction work around on the outside (though still very quiet inside). The interior is extremely warm and comfortable, which leather lounge chairs and sofas. Very impressed! I had the the duck, which was small, though very filling. If you like to have a larger meal, I would recommend get extra sides. Disappointinly, the waitress didn't really understand the wine list, nor did she send over the bar person to provide insight. In the end, 5 of us decided to walk over to ensure we had the appropriate mix. Great place for almost any occassion, let it be for groups of friends, paries or work related.

ZE5XmOUiBJeYwzsptdpqmw.text: Bill's has a very convenient location right in the High Kensington Street stop. The menu had a variety of options of entrees, I got the naked burger which a burger without a bun served with a side salad, it was overall good, the rest of the group I was with got either a regular burger or a chicken sandwich, all seemed satisfied with their meals. If I get the chance to go back to London I would like to try Bill's breakfast menu.

n0JjbhmSsqGvrBFIK43PkA.text: Bill's has become something of an addiction of ours. Breakfast, lunch, dinner - they've got a menu to satisfy all cravings (including a lovely little tea and scones combo). Ordering a starter, a main and a drink can get a bit pricey but the food hasn't disappointed. Chocolate brownie milkshake is A MUST. Great, prompt service. They keep us coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Avocado on toast, and 2 poached eggs
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian breakfast and avocado on toast (with additional bacon)
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Tea and scones

o-Hyd94rrDn6NzezfekR8Q.text: I have never been to Bill's. There, I said it. I've heard some rubbish reviews and just got put off but I've always found the menu interesting and because my friend and I were in need of a drink and snack stop, Bill's it was.After being shown to our table, there was no service for probably about 15 minutes, we had to call someone over and then the drinks took forever, only to find out their cocktail of the month was unavailable.Once our original server was back, everything was alot faster and efficient. Aperol spiritzs were lovely. Chips were fine and the crumbed calamari was actually quite good with none of that hideous frozen calamari you may find in other places. The duo of dips were unexpected and delicious. All in all, once the initial delay had been sorted, the experience was pleasant enough and I would go back to explore their menu further.

yK8jKy_esYd2GOYQbmgtLA.text: We got suckered into this place. The close proximity to our hotel and the above average reviews made it seem like a nice choice for a quick full English. This shit tasted gross. The bacon tasted like the crap we get in California. I feel like a vegetarian had too much input on these sausages because they were gross. A Denny's grand slam was better than this; I'll put it that way. Within 5 minutes of sitting down, I could tell it was a tourist trap, but it was too late to leave. The only positive out of this was that we had a window seat and saw plenty of bad bitches walk past--1 star. I'm writing this review while I sip on their tea. Nobody should have to go through this.

eOdfW8-oYR6YhEY8OlS-1A.text: When staying in Kensington, I was told to check out this place a couple of times. A group of 6 of us came into Bill's and ordered burgers. I ordered the buttermilk chicken burger, and it comes with sweet potato fries. I do not care for them, so I asked if I could substitute something from their list of sides. The waitress said "yes" so I chose the mac& cheese. The food was not bad, but when I got the bill I was charged for the burger& fries plus the mac& cheese. When I asked the manager, he did not even offer as much as a sorry. My bill was 19 pounds (the mac&cheese was 5 pounds), which equated to about $27 US dollars. If i pay $27 for a meal, it better be a steak or some amazing meal. I was very unhappy because it was their fault they gave me the incorrect information and were not apologetic.

m8dnfBtgmmX60ITD6RcMfw.text: Overall a bad experience. The restaurant was half empty. It took ages to order even though there was plenty of staff doing nothing. The food arrived in just about an acceptable time. We ordered the chicken Caesar salad, which was poor. Tepid chicken and cold egg. They forgot the dressing but brought the salad so we had to wait till the dressing arrived.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Poor Caesar salad with chicken.

NbjKAE76vbo0nv3khyKyyA.text: Great service however, I ordered Bill's Omelette and the ingredients were simply cold and placed inside a folded plain egg. The tea was okay but what really struck me was the musty atmosphere. Definitely worth a try but everything seems a bit half hearted.
